page.title: 06A BROWNHILLS DOCTOR'S DAY.
page.content: My father is a doctor in Brownhills. He usually gets up at 6.30am and then makes his own breakfast before journeying to his surgery which commences at 9am. He is very busy during the mornings, rarely coming home for lunch. His most demanding day is Monday when he averages 35 patients during the morning and 20 patients in the evening. He does not come home usually until 10pm, when I am asleep. He then changes into casual clothing and has a snack and a hot drink. His last task is to finish his paperwork in his study upstairs. This takes him until about 11.40pm which means that he has little chance of watching television. He then goes to bed at the end of a hard day's work.
